WRITING.TEXT: Yeah absolutely to that second part. That's the whole point of getting the armor sets because the elixirs are a bitch. It's all opinion but I feel that the armor sets add to the immersion. You can't just climb to the peak of a mountain naked.

You're not forced to do any of those things. Zora armor is needed to swim up waterfalls, but that isn't necessary because you could always get to locations by climbing. Meals and elixirs can be used for stealth and for stamina. Elixirs can be used to make you flameproof or heat resistant. Elixirs and meals can be used for cold resistance. There are very few cases where you truly need a set of armor to do something.
Edit: also, I think it's a great thing that certain armors are intended for certain purposes. Why would I wear climber gear other than to climb? Why would I use flamebreaker armor? I feel this mechanic is awesome because it rewards players for upgrading all of their armors and not just investing in a couple. Barbarian is my go to and my only fully upgrades set. I find it fun and challenging when I need to go do something on Death Mountain and all of the sudden I'm vulnerable because I haven't upgraded the flamebreaker set. The only complaint i have is that the second upgrade isn't always great. Climber gear should let you climb in the rain. Zora gear should pretty much let you swim freely without worrying about stamina.
I sure hope so

I honestly don't know. The screen is just too small for it. Which i'm fine with, I love the size of the console.

It's a for profit company. They need to do what they can to bring in profits. The supply can't be greater than the demand. The console launched early March, not in the fall before christmas. They couldn't know what the demand would be so they needed to play it safe.

I have had no problems with scratching at all. The stand is fine but honestly there's no need for it. Handheld mode is way better than tabletop mode. I love the portability of this system it's truly incredible.
Maybe you should preorder if you wanted the console. Sucks but this is how Nintendo operates. They can't afford to make a bunch of consoles that don't sell so they make a short supply.

They can show gratitude while still upholding their sacred laws (at least publicly). Riju and her bodyguard both know you are a voe but allow you in their city. I imagine it's much easier to just let Link sneak in as a girl than have it be this big thing that a voe is allowed in the city.
What's hurtful about Bolson? I found him lovable and hysterical. He was flamboyant, yes but he wasn't a total effeminate pansy. He and Karston are beasts of construction.

I don't think it's dumb. It's Gerudo law, doesn't matter that Link is a hero. They can't openly let a male in the city. Especially since Riju is young and needs to rule over the Gerudos, breaking a sacred Gerudo law and tradition would be a quick way to lose all respect and influence.

I disagree with climbing, food system and blessing shrines.
Climbing is one of my favorite things about the game and it gives you a reason to invest in stamina and create stamina potions or food. Also, it gives a reason to eat foods or use potions to increase speed, plus a reason to get a certain armor set. If you have invested in these things, you can much more easily traverse the world. If you haven't, you'll have to take he main paths which are longer are filled with enemies.
As far as the food system, I don't care that there aren't that many recipes. I like that cooking is straightforward and easy. You know exactly what you're going to get so you don't waste ingredients. Yeah it would be cool if certain foods mixed together created special effects but i don't care that much. My issue is that you can't compound effects. I should be able to increase attack power, defense and speed all at once. I hate that I can't. One effect will overwrite another.
Blessing shrines are fine because most of them are in hard to reach places or require some kind of puzzle just to get to them.

This is well thought out and articulates. I definitely see how she was selfish and acted out of her own insecurity. However, she had never once seen any indication that she would access the powers to seal away Ganon. Can you really blame her for being skeptical of her fate? She spent her whole life trying to access this power and she can't do it. She starts trying to find out other ways to stop Ganon besides the prophecy. It's not out of "poor me, I don't get to just do whatever I want" it's more like she can't fulfill her destiny and all of hyrule depends on her doing that. The pressure is unbearable to her and she's trapped devoting her life to something that is, in her eyes, futile.
Darude - Sandstorm

Did you watch all of the memories? She dedicated her entire life to learning the power to seal away Ganon. I actually have no idea what on Earth you are talking about when you say her decisions are stubborn and selfish.
